title: Anker Soundcore Sleep A30 Level Up the Formula for Sleep Earbuds
description: These earbuds bring everything that the Soundcore Sleep A20 had, and more.
author: Ayomide Sadiq
excerpt: These earbuds bring everything that the Soundcore Sleep A20 had, and more.
text: Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more. It's interesting how important sleep is, considering that when you're sleeping, you have no idea what is going on. Despite that, the difference in the morning after poor sleep and one after a great night's rest is clear. That's why people spend a lot of money on ensuring their sleep is sound, whether it is a mattress, earplugs, or a white noise machine. There's another thing you can look towards to help with your sleep, and that's sleep-focused earbuds, like the brand-new Soundcore Sleep A30. These work just like regular earbuds do, so you can enjoy them during the day, but when it comes to nighttime, they bring a lot of extra stuff that regular earbuds don't come close to providing. The Soundcore Sleep A30 Brings a Lot More to the Table Compared to Last Year Image: Anker Anker, one of my favorite companies when it comes to smartphone charging accessories, also puts the work in when it comes to audio products. It does so under the sub-brand Soundcore, which you've likely heard of before, and today, Soundcore has just launched the Sleep A30 earbuds via Kickstarter. These might seem like regular earbuds, but they bring a lot more than just great sound quality, so let's talk about that. Slimmer, Softer Build and Design Image: Anker The Soundcore Sleep A30 is built for comfort, with earbuds that are 7% slimmer than last year's model. That makes them noticeably more comfortable for people who sleep on their sides (like me). The earbuds are available in classic white and mist green this year, and you'll get several silicone ear tips, memory foam ear tips, and ear wings, so you'll always be able to figure out a perfect fit for your ears. Delivers a Sleep-Conducive Soundscape for a Peaceful Night's Rest Image: Anker The Sleep A30 does a lot to make sure that your sleep is as sweet as possible. The earbuds come with “AI brainwave audio”, which delivers specific frequencies to each ear to induce calming brainwaves that help with sleep, meditation, and even concentration. There's also a range of colored noise and sounds to choose from, giving you the power to always fall asleep to what you find calming. Active Noise Cancelation and Snore Masking Image: Anker One aspect in which the new A30 beats out the older models is that it comes with ANC, capable of blocking up to 30dB of noise. And what's even better is that the case comes with what Soundcore calls Adaptive Snore Masking. The case detects snoring, analyzes it, and then sends audio to the earbuds to properly mask it. Soundcore Sleep A30Soundcore Sleep A20Active Noise CancelationYesNoSnore MaskingReal-Time AdaptiveRegularMemory Foam EartipsYesNoCall MicrophoneYesNoSleep AudioAI Brainwave Audio (Sleep, Meditation, Focus)AI Brainwave Audio (Sleep) Battery Life to Last Days and Days Image: Anker Of course, you'll want sleep earbuds that will at least last you through an entire night, and thankfully, these Sleep A30 will do that, with 9 hours of playback off of a single charge. With the case, which extends to a total of 45 hours, so you can get several nights of sleep off a single full charge. Availability and Pricing Image: Anker The Anker Soundcore Sleep A30 can be pre-ordered starting today. You'll only be able to make your pre-order from Kickstarter, though in August, they should launch officially on Amazon and the Soundcore website. The Sleep A30 is expected to cost: $229.99 in the US An equivalent price point in the UK and Europe at the time of checkout As low as $139 through early backer perks on Kickstarter Through Tecno, Gionee, Vivo, Google, and now Samsung, Ayomide has always been an Android enthusiast. His current partner in crime is a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. You can find him playing Candy Crush or Call of Duty: Mobile, watching movies, and he is a big fan of trivia and quizzes. Previous Post
html:
Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more.

It's interesting how important sleep is, considering that when you're sleeping, you have no idea what is going on. Despite that, the difference in the morning after poor sleep and one after a great night's rest is clear. That's why people spend a lot of money on ensuring their sleep is sound, whether it is a mattress, earplugs, or a white noise machine.

There's another thing you can look towards to help with your sleep, and that's sleep-focused earbuds, like the brand-new Soundcore Sleep A30. These work just like regular earbuds do, so you can enjoy them during the day, but when it comes to nighttime, they bring a lot of extra stuff that regular earbuds don't come close to providing.

The Soundcore Sleep A30 Brings a Lot More to the Table Compared to Last Year

Anker, one of my favorite companies when it comes to smartphone charging accessories, also puts the work in when it comes to audio products. It does so under the sub-brand Soundcore, which you've likely heard of before, and today, Soundcore has just launched the Sleep A30 earbuds via Kickstarter. These might seem like regular earbuds, but they bring a lot more than just great sound quality, so let's talk about that.

Slimmer, Softer Build and Design

The Soundcore Sleep A30 is built for comfort, with earbuds that are 7% slimmer than last year's model. That makes them noticeably more comfortable for people who sleep on their sides (like me).

The earbuds are available in classic white and mist green this year, and you'll get several silicone ear tips, memory foam ear tips, and ear wings, so you'll always be able to figure out a perfect fit for your ears.

Delivers a Sleep-Conducive Soundscape for a Peaceful Night's Rest

The Sleep A30 does a lot to make sure that your sleep is as sweet as possible. The earbuds come with “AI brainwave audio”, which delivers specific frequencies to each ear to induce calming brainwaves that help with sleep, meditation, and even concentration.

There's also a range of colored noise and sounds to choose from, giving you the power to always fall asleep to what you find calming.

Active Noise Cancelation and Snore Masking

One aspect in which the new A30 beats out the older models is that it comes with ANC, capable of blocking up to 30dB of noise. And what's even better is that the case comes with what Soundcore calls Adaptive Snore Masking. The case detects snoring, analyzes it, and then sends audio to the earbuds to properly mask it.

Battery Life to Last Days and Days

Of course, you'll want sleep earbuds that will at least last you through an entire night, and thankfully, these Sleep A30 will do that, with 9 hours of playback off of a single charge. With the case, which extends to a total of 45 hours, so you can get several nights of sleep off a single full charge.

Availability and Pricing

The Anker Soundcore Sleep A30 can be pre-ordered starting today. You'll only be able to make your pre-order from Kickstarter, though in August, they should launch officially on Amazon and the Soundcore website.

The Sleep A30 is expected to cost:

  • $229.99 in the US
  • An equivalent price point in the UK and Europe at the time of checkout
  • As low as $139 through early backer perks on Kickstarter

Through Tecno, Gionee, Vivo, Google, and now Samsung, Ayomide has always been an Android enthusiast. His current partner in crime is a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. You can find him playing Candy Crush or Call of Duty: Mobile, watching movies, and he is a big fan of trivia and quizzes.
